AL101.name: Arts and Letters Freshman Experience
AL101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL101.description: Foundation for optimizing educational experiences in the liberal and creative arts and humanities.
AL101.restrictions: Open to freshmen in the College of Arts and Letters.

AL110.name: Writing and Civic Life
AL110.description: Study and practice of invention, arrangement, revision, style, and delivery of writing, reading, and researching in higher education. Rhetorical practices useful in democratic deliberation about social, cultural, and political problems.
AL110.prerequisite: (WRA 1004) or designated score on English Placement test

AL114.name: Creativity and Innovative Entrepreneurship
AL114.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL114.description: Creative processes, complex problem solving and innovative entrepreneurship. Examination of successful social, cultural and corporate thinkers and creators. Activities focused on inquiry, observation, experimentation and networking for situational problem solving.

AL200.name: Cultural Difference and Study Abroad
AL200.description: Tools for understanding and interacting with individuals from different cultural backgrounds. Awareness of and sensitivity to cultural difference and the role of language study in understanding cultural difference. Preparation for continued study of and exposure to different cultures and languages through study abroad.

AL210.name: Democratic Discourse and Critique in the Arts and Humanities
AL210.description: Arts and humanities contributions to identifying and solving social, cultural, and political problems. Various modes of participation and engagement by diverse groups in democratic discourse broadly understood. Political debate, public discourse, critique, protest, dissent, and artistic expression.

AL250.name: Career Strategies for Arts and Letters Students
AL250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL250.description: Identify, explore, and prepare for suitable career options. Topics include self-assessment, career development strategies, and job search skills.
AL250.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.

AL290.name: Arts and Letters Service Learning
AL290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL290.description: Supervised community-engaged service and/or field experience and reflection.
AL290.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AL290.restrictions: Not open to freshmen. Approval of department. A student may earn a maximum of 12 credits A student may earn a maximum of 12 credits combined between this course and AL 493A/B

AL300.name: Starting your Business in the Creative, Visual, and Theatre Arts
AL300.description: Pursuing a career in arts such as theatre, film, dance, photography, and studio art. Business, financial, and marketing strategies for the individual artist.
AL300.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Arts and Letters or approval of department.

AL400.name: Study Abroad in Arts and Letters
AL400.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL400.description: Supervised study of selected topics in the arts, languages, history, philosophy, and religious studies, in relation to particular cultural sites, museums and institutions.
AL400.restrictions: Not open to freshmen. Approval of college.

AL431.name: European Fairy Tale Tradition
AL431.description: Integrative exploration of fairy tale genre through time and cultures, introduced through multiple disciplines within Arts and Letters.
AL431.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

AL490.name: Independent Study
AL490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL490.description: Special project, directed reading and research arranged by an undergraduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
AL490.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.

AL491.name: Special Topics
AL491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on group study basis.
AL491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

AL492A.name: Capstone Seminar in Interdisciplinary Humanities (W)
AL492A.description: Capstone experience drawing together various perspectives in arts and humanities. Nature of humanities and arts in general. Integration of students' diverse courses of study.
AL492A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AL492A.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Interdisciplinary Humanities Major or approval of college.

AL492B.name: Capstone Seminar in Humanities and Law (W)
AL492B.description: Capstone experience drawing together various approaches in arts, humanities, and social science related to law. Integration of students' diverse courses of study.
AL492B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AL492B.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Humanities-Prelaw Major or approval of college.

AL493A.name: Arts and Letters Internship
AL493A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL493A.description: Supervised preprofessional field experience in the arts and humanities.
AL493A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.
AL493A.restrictions: Not open to sophomores. Approval of college. A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in AL 493A and AL 493B combined.

AL493B.name: Arts and Letters International Internship
AL493B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL493B.description: Supervised preprofessional international field experience in the arts and humanities.
AL493B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AL493B.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and not open to sophomores. Approval of college.

AL493C.name: Museum Internship
AL493C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL493C.description: Activities, functions and organization of a museum.
AL493C.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

AL810.name: Historiography and Social Science Methods in Chicano/Latino Studies
AL810.description: Historical, political, economic, and cultural approaches to the study of peoples of Indo-Afro-Hispano origins in the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean.

AL811.name: Literary and Cultural Theory in Chicano/Latino Studies
AL811.description: Comparative global examination of experiences of peoples of Indo-Afro-Hispano origin in the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean. Exploration of intersecting experiences of race and ethnicity.

AL821.name: Proseminar in Comparative Literature
AL821.description: History and practice of comparative literature including foundational concepts and current directions.
AL821.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.

AL823.name: Seminar in Comparative Literary Criticism
AL823.description: Theory and practice of comparative literary criticism, with attention to the development of critical approaches and to current topics in the critical literature.
AL823.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.

AL827.name: Pro-seminar in Critical and Cultural Theory
AL827.description: Basic concepts in critical and cultural theory drawn from across the disciplines in the humanities.

AL842.name: Writing Workshop for Teachers
AL842.description: Examination of techniques for teaching. Directed practice in writing.
AL842.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters or College of Education or approval of college.

AL883.name: Practicum in Blended and Online Learning
AL883.description: Build and assess an online course of their choice. Study learning theory and educational technology research, and engage in conversation about online and hybrid courses methods.
AL883.restrictions: Open to graduate students. Approval of college.

AL890.name: Independent Study
AL890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL890.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

AL891.name: Special Topics in Arts and Humanities
AL891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings, proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

AL892.name: Seminar
AL892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL892.description: Directed original research and its presentation. Current topics in Arts and Letters.
AL892.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters.

AL893B.name: Internship in Professional Writing
AL893B.description: Internship in a corporate, organizational, or publishing setting. Classroom discussion of workplace issues and documents.

AL893E.name: Readings in Chicano/Latino Studies
AL893E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL893E.description: Directed research and readings on selected topics in collaboration with Chicano/Latino Studies faculty member.

AL894.name: Fieldwork in Chicano/Latino Studies
AL894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL894.description: Social action research on selected topic in collaboration with a Chicano/Latino Studies faculty member in area of interest.

AL896.name: Seminar in Chicano/Latino Studies
AL896.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AL896.description: Selected topics in Chicano/Latino studies. Theories, issues, methodological innovations.
AL896.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Chicano/Latino Studies major. Approval of department.

AL898.name: Master's Research
AL898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL898.description: Directed research in support of Plan B Master's program requirements

AL899.name: Master's Thesis Research
AL899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL899.description: Directed research leading to a master's thesis, used in partial fulfillment of plan A master's degree requirements.

AL999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
AL999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AL999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Arts and Letters.
